name: NPR
text:
Prison abolitionist Mariame Kaba: "I imagine a whole generation of young people being born in this moment who are going to grow up understanding that the world doesn't have to be this way. We don't have to have prisons, policing and surveillance."
https://t.co/7UtBecUltX

name: NPR
text:
Author Ijeoma Oluo says white male mediocrity — or "this idea that white men deserve political power and wealth and safety...just because they're white men" — has most greatly impacted women and people of color. 

But she says it's also killing white men. 
https://t.co/IguKsJQsf7

name: NPR
text:
A new study of toddlers in Kenya suggests that having an older sister can have a powerful impact on a child's development — leading to improved early vocabulary and fine motor skills.
https://t.co/YHcfQmyfgK

name: NPR
text: Este and Alana Haim — two-thirds of @HAIMtheband — joined @waitwait to play a game called "You're my Wonderwall": 3 questions about Liam and Noel Gallagher, the brothers behind Oasis. https://t.co/bNHr9bWgAH

name: NPR
text:
New Zealand says it will provide free doses of coronavirus vaccines to its residents as well as neighboring nations Tokelau, Cook Islands, Niue, Samoa, Tonga, and Tuvalu, should they want them.
https://t.co/pgSojFM4i3

name: NPR
text:
For many people, this is the first year they'll spend the holidays away from family. That separation is something the more than 1 million international students studying in the U.S. this year are familiar with.

Here's how they've learned to cope:
https://t.co/3HXF92dV7B

name: NPR
text:
It's been 50 years since Puerto Rican singer José Feliciano first came up with "Feliz Navidad," because he missed his family.

Now, he's recorded a new version with 30 friends — including Lin-Manuel Miranda, Gloria Gaynor, Jason Mraz and La India.
https://t.co/f1oTzB8VAb

name: NPR
text:
This documentary about the 76 days of Wuhan's lockdown isn't just a harrowing tribute to its frontline workers and patients, our reviewer says.

It's a wake-up call for those of us in countries that are still fighting.
https://t.co/DidVGji4gs

name: NPR
text:
The atmosphere is as much a part of "The Mandalorian" as the characters. 

Thanks to set designer Andrew L. Jones, this season takes viewers across the galaxy — from the desert dunes of Tatooine to a military base deep under a volcanic plain. @hereandnow https://t.co/84mNZVaMeV

name: NPR
text: An incalculable reserve of wisdom and experience disappeared as these groundbreaking musicians died in 2020, but they left behind is a monumental body of work, spanning all conceivable corners of sound and style. https://t.co/xciQBExWdw

name: NPR
text: With his new Netflix holiday musical "Jingle Jangle," David E. Talbert wanted to write a holiday movie that would not only inspire him but also his son, the way Willy Wonka or Mary Poppins sparked his imagination as a child. https://t.co/JytILyzetP

name: NPR
text:
48 states, plus Puerto Rico and D.C., are now at the highest COVID-19 risk level, with unchecked community spread of the coronavirus.

Explore the trends in your area here: https://t.co/KhMfLZj1ap https://t.co/0jt2PVSwAG

name: NPR
text: Congress is closer to passing a $900 billion COVID relief package, officials say. Votes could come as soon as Sunday. https://t.co/lMvZrkytTh

name: NPR
text: Just as the FDA authorized a second COVID-19 vaccine, some 7.9 million doses are ready for distribution next week. https://t.co/sD9HJ14RC2

name: NPR
text:
Topeka, Kansas 
North Platte, Nebraska 
Hamilton, Ohio
Newtown, Iowa

These are some of the U.S. cities that will pay you to move there. https://t.co/5lckNEM359

name: NPR
text: "Just like we need a unified national response to COVID-19, we need a unified national response to climate change," President-elect Biden said. "We need to meet the moment with the urgency it demands as we would during any national emergency." https://t.co/63clPlE16P

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRGoatsandSoda: Happening in an hour or so! 

Join us TODAY at 2:30PM ET for a choose-your-own-adventure-style storytelling workshop. Learn how to ...

- draw your own comic!
- conduct an interview!
- take a telling portrait! 

RSVP for the event here https://t.co/ORm9lqwMGz

name: NPR
text: President-elect Biden's proposed climate team illustrates an agenda markedly different from that of the Trump presidency. https://t.co/YdMNIN3yCR

name: NPR
text: The Democratic challengers in the Georgia runoffs are focusing on health care — hoping it will motivate voters amid the pandemic. https://t.co/UEHYGJQi0u

name: NPR
text: "Can you please find a cure for Covid-19," Jonah wrote to Santa. Kids across the country are wishing for an end to the pandemic this holiday season. https://t.co/FFZGxcCq5J

name: NPR
text:
Every year, USPS makes children's letters to Santa available for anyone to "adopt" to help make their holiday wishes come true.

This year's letters offer a glimpse at the psyche of kids toughing it out through a crisis unlike anything they've experienced. https://t.co/QjqNBX1jrD https://t.co/9WSORhJsIU

name: NPR
text: The U.K. is cracking down with tight new coronavirus restrictions for London and the southeast of England — cancelling Christmas gatherings for many households. https://t.co/UmnpzjRvSy

name: NPR
text: People who are ages 75 and older and frontline essential workers should be next in line to get a COVID-19 vaccine, a federal advisory committee to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said Sunday. https://t.co/358ixYM8bp
